content: Yeah I see now what you mean, seems possible... But in a way it similarly would mean paying every time for something that could have been validated once (DATALOAD's argument)

author: big_tech_sux
content: i think the benefit of deploy-time validation of initcode would be greater in terms of gas cost

author: big_tech_sux
content: that 1 gas is really not a lot :), and it costs an opcode slot

author: big_tech_sux
content: also something that is interesting (and i'm not sure if desired), DATALOADN is currently cheaper than a PUSH instruction.

author: big_tech_sux
content: so now we can get rid of all PUSH instructions ðŸ™‚

author: big_tech_sux
content: btw, i also think the idea of being able to "dynamically" (i.e., at deploy-time) set the size of eof data section is a bit weird. typically factories already know the size of the data section that they want to deploy. so a restriction on the size of the data section might also help achieve deploy-time validation of initcode. (you don't know what is in the data section yet, but you have bounds on the size, so you can validate DATALOADN).
